data.title: Company Profile
data.meta_description: SGI - High-performance computing hardware manufacturer. Acquired by Hewlett Packard Enterprise. Raised funding over 1 round from 6 investors. Founded by James Clark in the year 1980. SGI has 133 competitors.

SGI - About the company

What does SGI do?

SGI offers server, storage, and software products for high performance compute applications. Its servers use shared memory systems for compute and data-intensive workloads. It also offers an integrated software environment from deskside to supercomputer. The company's services also include consulting, file management. The company operates in predominantly Visual Reality, Green Computing, Digital Content Management, and manufacturing Design. The company was founded as Rackable Systems and rebranded itself as SGI in March 2009.

Which sectors and market segments does SGI operate in?

SGI serves in the B2B space .

SGI's acquisition details

SGI got acquired by Hewlett Packard Enterprise on Aug 11, 2016 at an acquisition amount of $275M. It was facilitated by DBO Partners .

Click here to take a look at SGI 's acquisition in detail

SGI's funding and investors

How much funding has SGI raised till date?

SGI has raised funding over 1 round.

What are the most recent funding rounds of SGI?

Its latest funding round was a Conventional Debt round on Jan 28, 2015 for $70M. 1 investor participated in its latest round, which include Tennenbaum Capital Partners.

SGI's Competitors and alternates

Competitive landscape of SGI

SGI ranks 11 th among 133 competitors which include Suse, Panzura and Altair. 11 of its competitors are funded while 29 have exited. Overall, SGI and its competitors have raised over $1.29B in funding across 100 funding rounds involving 267 investors. There are 5 public and 24 acquired companies in the entire competition set.
